rev.comment: Removing Sitemaps section, as it makes no reference to criticism or controversy (and I'm unable to find any Sitemap-related controversy elsewhere on the Web).
rev.diff:
Line 176: Line 176:
Google recently settled a patent infringement lawsuit with [[Yahoo!]] by issuing 2.7 million shares. Yahoo! had earlier alleged that Google's AdSense program violated a patent held by Yahoo!'s Overture unit. The settlement cost Google around $275 million which resulted in the company posting a net loss in the third quarter of 2004.
Google recently settled a patent infringement lawsuit with [[Yahoo!]] by issuing 2.7 million shares. Yahoo! had earlier alleged that Google's AdSense program violated a patent held by Yahoo!'s Overture unit. The settlement cost Google around $275 million which resulted in the company posting a net loss in the third quarter of 2004.
â
===Personal issues===
+
===Personnel issues===
â  
Former Google sales executive Christina Elwell, promoted to national sales director at Google in late 2003, accused her supervisor of discrimination against her ([http://news.com.com/Google+hit+with+job+discrimination+lawsuit/2100-1030_3-5807158.html?tag=nl see here]) after informing him of her pregnancy. After the loss of 3 of her quadruplets, which she claimed was due to the stressful circumstances created by Google, Elwell sued the company. She also refused an offer from Shona Brown, Google Vice President of Business Operations, to reinstate her to a "low-level operations position". <!--did she win? did she lose? is the case still ongoing?-->
Former Google sales executive Christina Elwell, promoted to national sales director at Google in late 2003, accused her supervisor of discrimination against her ([http://news.com.com/Google+hit+with+job+discrimination+lawsuit/2100-1030_3-5807158.html?tag=nl see here]) after informing him of her pregnancy. After the loss of 3 of her quadruplets, which she claimed was due to the stressful circumstances created by Google, Elwell sued the company. She also refused an offer from Shona Brown, Google Vice President of Business Operations, to reinstate her to a "low-level operations position". <!--did she win? did she lose? is the case still ongoing?-->
Line 198: Line 198:
===The PageRank system===
===The PageRank system===
Google's central PageRank system has been criticized, some calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. The system is also susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites. See [[Google bomb]] and [[Spamdexing]].
Google's central PageRank system has been criticized, some calling it "undemocratic". Common arguments are that the system is unfairly biased towards large web sites, and that the criteria for a page's importance are not subject to [[peer review]]. The system is also susceptible to manipulation and fraud through the use of dummy sites. See [[Google bomb]] and [[Spamdexing]].
â   â
===The Sitemap system===
  â
[[Google Sitemap]] is an experiment in web crawling. Using Sitemaps to inform and direct their crawlers Google hope to expand their coverage of the web and improve the time to inclusion in their index. By placing a Sitemap-formatted file on a webserver, a site owner enables Google's crawlers to find out what pages are present and which have recently changed, and to crawl the site accordingly.
